p: Metformin has commonly been used as the first line pharmacologic agent for treating diabetes and pre-diabetes as per the American Diabetes Association guidelines [ 18]. Metformin improves glycemic control by decreasing hepatic glucose production, decreasing glucose absorption in the intestines and stomach, and increasing insulin-mediated glucose uptake [ 19]. Metformin has shown cardio-protective effects by increasing endothelial progenitor cells and CFU-Hill's colonies in type 1 diabetes, and is known to also have cardio-protective properties in type 2 diabetes [ 20â€“ 22].
